oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Further details concerning what occurs at the death of a sorcerer, and concerning the harmful and beneficial doings of sorcerers (L V.-19. 5506-5530). When a sorcerer dies, an earthquake takes place, and a star shoots. Even when asleep, a sorcerer knows what is going about in the night; and takes care of the people, defending them from the sorcerers. (L V.-19. 5531-5536 1/2). Sorcerers' hearts sound like the rain when they die and their hearts fall into waterpits. Parents say they fear falling stars, because they know things that happen and always fall for a reason. Sorcerers can send their sorcery to different places to 'spirit' people away or kill them. 1) Dia!kwain was told this story by his mother (=kamme-an), 2) pp.5505v & 5506v: see Dia!kwain's explanation of the name which his mother gave him, 3) pp.5506v-5512v: see More about sorcerers, 4) p.5524v: |xam terms for the anointing and smearing of blood from the healer's nose on the patient, 5) See also Falling stars, 6) This story is found in Book V-19.
